intro: Chonemorpha fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant chonemorpha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its pleasant scent and visual appeal.
